body:
Are you going to port this game to Android?

It could be a great idea :)
author: [pal...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109650523438714887696/)
title: Porting to other platforms

comments.body:
Not in the near future, unless Android start supporting Swing. The current GUI is written using Java's Swing framework which is not supported on the Android platform. A port would require rewriting the GUI using Android's custom UI, and that would be a huge undertaking.

**Summary:** Android port  
  **Labels:** -Type-Defect Type-Enhancement
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body:
Changed priority to low as this is not likely to be done any time soon.

**Labels:** -Priority-Medium Priority-Low
comments.author: [BeHold...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/116281131070537299190/)

comments.body:
Rather than port to a single platform, rewriting the UI layer in something like the PlayN framework, https://developers.google.com/playn/ , would allow us to target multiple platforms. For example, a web based version would make it a lot easier for folks to try out the program without installing anything.

**Summary:** Porting to other platforms
